definitions: To become red in the face, typically from embarrassment, heat, or exertion.
To cleanse or empty (a toilet or drain) by causing water to flow through it.
To drive (an animal, bird, or person) from a hiding place.
To be level or in the same plane with another surface.
examples: She began to flush when he complimented her.
He forgot to flush the toilet.
The dogs flushed the pheasants out of the bushes.
The new cabinet doors are designed to flush with the wall.
